summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the handling of Touhy requests (requests for government information in third-party litigation) from victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It details internal coordination on drafting response letters, concerns about disclosable information, and the complexities of dealing with requests for materials from other districts (S.D. Fla., N.D. Ga.).

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Point person for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims; drafts and circulates response letters and coordinates with the criminal team.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Provides guidance and approval on Touhy request responses, raises concerns about Giglio disclosures and jurisdictional issues.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: Copied on email chain regarding Touhy request procedures and discussions.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Part of the criminal prosecution team; coordinates with Steven Kochevar on victim requests and plans calls with victim's counsel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the underlying criminal investigation and civil litigation; victims are requesting information related to him.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified in an email as a Jane Doe plaintiff/victim who submitted a Touhy request; mentioned in context of immunity discussions from the S.D. Fla. investigation.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney for an Epstein victim (plaintiff) who made an initial Touhy request; correspondence is addressed to her.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Mentioned as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the Civil Division to be consulted on complex jurisdictional questions.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Referred to as the 'responsible' U.S. Attorney who might receive a Touhy-referred subpoena from another district.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Jeffrey O
persons.context: Mentioned as having been consulted about continuing to use Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: An AUSA to whom an initial victim request was made, before being forwarded to Steven Kochevar.

connections.description: Frequent email correspondence regarding the approval and drafting of Touhy response letters; Kochevar seeks McEnany's guidance and approval.
Coordinate on handling victim requests; Alex from the criminal team provides context and Kochevar from civil handles external communications.
Both are copied on internal strategy emails about Touhy request procedures.
Kaplan is identified as counsel for an Epstein victim; Lacerda is identified as a victim/Jane Doe, suggesting Kaplan represents her or similar victims.
Kochevar is the government attorney drafting official Touhy responses to requests from Kaplan, who represents victims.

events.title: Designation of Touhy Point Person
events.description: John McEnany confirms that Steven Kochevar will be the point of contact for handling Touhy requests related to Jeffrey Epstein from civil plaintiffs/victims.

events.title: Production of Documents to Victim
events.description: Steven Kochevar circulates a letter and documents to be produced in response to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit against Epstein's estate.

events.title: Follow-up on Victim's Touhy Request
events.description: Kochevar informs the team that they produced documents to a victim, received follow-up questions, and plan to tell the victim's counsel they will not produce more at this time. They also discuss redirecting requests for S.D. Fla. materials to N.D. Ga.

events.title: Updated Letter to Epstein Victim
events.description: Kochevar sends an updated Touhy response letter to an Epstein victim, noting the Maxwell team has signed off on it.

events.title: Internal Review of Letter Draft
events.description: Email exchange about adding qualifiers to a Touhy response letter and confirming its accuracy before sending.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was handling Touhy requests (for government information) from victims of Jeffrey Epstein involved in civil litigation.
Internal discussions reveal complexity and caution: concerns about Giglio disclosures, grand jury (6(e)) materials, law enforcement privilege, and not interfering with ongoing investigations.

The office did not possess files from the U.S. Attorney's Office in S.D. Fla. related to the earlier Epstein investigation, due to conflict issues, discovery concerns, and the prior non-prosecution agreement.
A victim identified in the emails is Maria Lacerda, who was seeking information, including about purported immunity discussions related to her from the S.D. Fla. investigation.
The correspondence shows coordination between Civil Division AUSAs (handling Touhy requests) and Criminal Division AUSAs (possessing investigative knowledge) within SDNY.
